title: Baseline Characteristics Tables
text: Population summary tables provide counts percentages different analysis populations. Analysis Populations Population Placebo Xanomeline High Dose Xanomeline Low Dose Safety 86 84 84 ITT = Intent--Treat Population Safety = Safety Population (subjects received study drug)
code: pop_table <- create_population_summary_table(   adsl = adsl,   trt_var = "TRT01P",   pop_flags = c("SAFFL"),   pop_labels = c("Safety") )  # Display the table pop_table@flextable

title: Baseline Characteristics Tables
text: GBA/AMNOG dossiers regulatory submissions, assessing baseline balance treatment groups critical. standardized mean difference (SMD) provides standardized measure covariate balance independent sample size.

title: Baseline Characteristics Tables
code: # Calculate SMD for a continuous variable smd_age <- calculate_smd_from_data(   data = adsl,   var = "AGE",   trt_var = "TRT01P",   ref_group = "Placebo" )  # View SMD result cat("Age SMD:", round(smd_age$smd, 3),     "95% CI: (", round(smd_age$ci_lower, 3), ",",     round(smd_age$ci_upper, 3), ")\n") #> Age SMD: -0.1 95% CI: ( -0.401 , 0.2 )  # Calculate SMD for a categorical variable smd_sex <- calculate_smd_from_data(   data = adsl,   var = "SEX",   trt_var = "TRT01P",   ref_group = "Placebo" )  cat("Sex SMD:", round(smd_sex$smd, 3), "\n") #> Sex SMD: 0.282

title: Baseline Characteristics Tables
text: Use assess_baseline_balance() complete assessment multiple variables:
code:
# Assess balance for continuous and categorical variables balance <- assess_baseline_balance(   data = adsl,   trt_var = "TRT01P",   continuous_vars = c("AGE", "WEIGHTBL"),   categorical_vars = c("SEX", "RACE", "ETHNIC"),   ref_group = "Placebo",   threshold = 0.1  # Standard threshold for imbalance )  # Check overall balance cat("Number of variables assessed:", balance@n_vars, "
") #> Number of variables assessed: 4 cat("Number of imbalanced variables (|SMD| > 0.1):", balance@n_imbalanced, "
") #> Number of imbalanced variables (|SMD| > 0.1): 2 cat("Overall balanced:", balance@balanced, "
") #> Overall balanced: FALSE  # View imbalanced variables (if any) if (length(balance@imbalanced_vars) > 0) {   imbalanced <- paste(balance@imbalanced_vars, collapse = ", ")   cat("Imbalanced variables:", imbalanced, "
") } #> Imbalanced variables: AGE, SEX

title: Baseline Characteristics Tables
text: Add SMD values directly demographics table data:
code: # Generate SMD table smd_results <- add_smd_to_table(   data = adsl,   trt_var = "TRT01P",   vars = c("AGE", "SEX", "RACE", "ETHNIC"),   ref_group = "Placebo",   threshold = 0.1 )  # View the results smd_results |>   dplyr::select(variable, smd_display, ci, var_type, imbalanced) #>   variable smd_display              ci    var_type imbalanced #> 1      AGE     -0.100* (-0.401, 0.200)  continuous       TRUE #> 2      SEX      0.282* (-0.018, 0.583) categorical       TRUE #> 3     RACE      -0.085 (-0.385, 0.216) categorical      FALSE #> 4   ETHNIC      -0.005 (-0.305, 0.296) categorical      FALSE

title: Baseline Characteristics Tables
text: Love plot (covariate balance plot) provides visual summary balance across covariates:  Variables |SMD| > 0.1 (outside dashed lines) may indicate meaningful imbalance discussed adjusted sensitivity analyses.
code: # Create Love plot from balance assessment love_plot <- create_love_plot(   balance_assessment = balance,   threshold = 0.1,   title = "Baseline Covariate Balance",   show_ci = TRUE )  # Display the plot love_plot@plot

title: Baseline Characteristics Tables
text: Combine baseline tables report. Word document contains formatted baseline tables.
code: # Create report sections demo_section <- ReportSection(   title = "Demographics",   content = demo_table )  region_section <- ReportSection(   title = "Enrollment by Region",   content = region_table )  mh_section <- ReportSection(   title = "Medical History",   content = mh_table )  # cm_section <- ReportSection( #   title = "Concomitant Medications", #   content = cm_table # )  # Create clinical report report <- ClinicalReport(   title = "Baseline Characteristics",   sections = list(     demo_section,     region_section,     mh_section   ) )  # Generate Word document generate_word(report, path = tempfile(fileext = ".docx"))

title: Creating Efficacy Tables
text: Create efficacy tables clinical study reports: time--event analysis, response rates, subgroup analyses, change baseline endpoints.

title: Creating Efficacy Tables
text: Use pharmaverseadam example data:
code: library(pharmhand) library(dplyr) library(tidyr) library(ggplot2) library(survival)  # Set flextable defaults for readable tables in light/dark mode flextable::set_flextable_defaults(   font.color = "#000000",   background.color = "#FFFFFF" ) library(pharmaverseadam)  # Load example datasets adsl <- pharmaverseadam::adsl         # Subject-level data advs <- pharmaverseadam::advs         # Vital signs data adlb <- pharmaverseadam::adlb         # Laboratory data adtte <- pharmaverseadam::adtte_onco  # Time-to-event data (oncology) adrs <- pharmaverseadam::adrs_onco    # Response data (oncology)  # Note: adtte_onco and adrs_onco use ARM as treatment variable (not TRT01P)

title: Creating Efficacy Tables
text: create_tte_summary_table() provides survival analysis Kaplan-Meier estimates, hazard ratios, landmark analyses.

title: Creating Efficacy Tables
text: Overall Survival Summary Statistic Placebo Xanomeline High Dose Xanomeline Low Dose N 174 169 169 Events n (%) 5 (2.9) 3 (1.8) 2 (1.2) Median (95% CI) NE NE NE HR (95% CI) Reference 0.84 (0.20, 3.53) 0.56 (0.11, 2.92) p-value - 0.809 0.492 Time unit: months HR reference group: Placebo NE = Estimable
code: # Create TTE summary table # Note: adtte_onco uses ARM for treatment groups tte_table <- create_tte_summary_table(   data = adtte,   time_var = "AVAL",   event_var = "CNSR",   trt_var = "ARM",  # Use ARM instead of TRT01P for oncology data   title = "Overall Survival Summary" )  # Display the table tte_table@flextable

title: Creating Efficacy Tables
text: Progression-Free Survival Landmark Analysis Statistic Placebo Xanomeline High Dose Xanomeline Low Dose N 174 169 169 Events n (%) 5 (2.9) 3 (1.8) 2 (1.2) Median (95% CI) NE NE NE 12-months Rate (95% CI) 97.8 (94.8, 100.0) 100.0 (100.0, 100.0) 100.0 (100.0, 100.0) 24-months Rate (95% CI) 97.8 (94.8, 100.0) 100.0 (100.0, 100.0) 100.0 (100.0, 100.0) HR (95% CI) Reference 0.84 (0.20, 3.53) 0.56 (0.11, 2.92) p-value - 0.809 0.492 Time unit: months HR reference group: Placebo NE = Estimable
code: # TTE table with landmark survival estimates tte_landmark <- create_tte_summary_table(   data = adtte,   time_var = "AVAL",   event_var = "CNSR",   trt_var = "ARM",   landmarks = c(12, 24),  # 12 and 24 month survival rates   time_unit = "months",   title = "Progression-Free Survival with Landmark Analysis" )  # Display the table tte_landmark@flextable

title: Creating Efficacy Tables
code: # Basic KM plot km_plot <- create_km_plot(   data = adtte,   time_var = "AVAL",   event_var = "CNSR",   trt_var = "ARM",   title = "Overall Survival Kaplan-Meier Plot",   show_median = TRUE,   show_ci = TRUE,   xlab = "Days" ) km_plot@plot # Advanced KM plot with risk table km_plot_advanced <- create_km_plot(   data = adtte,   time_var = "AVAL",   event_var = "CNSR",   trt_var = "ARM",   title = "Survival Analysis with Risk Table",   show_median = TRUE,   show_ci = TRUE,   xlab = "Days",   risk_table = TRUE,   landmarks = c(12, 24) ) km_plot_advanced@plot

title: Creating Efficacy Tables
text: create_responder_table() provides response summaries multiple comparison options.

title: Creating Efficacy Tables
text: Best Overall Response Rate Treatment n/N Rate (%) 95% CI (95% CI) p-value Placebo 8/1042 0.8 (0.4, 1.5) Reference - Screen Failure 0/624 0.0 (0.0, 0.6) 0.00 (0.00, Inf) 0.989 Xanomeline High Dose 3/1016 0.3 (0.1, 0.9) 0.38 (0.10, 1.45) 0.157 Xanomeline Low Dose 4/1012 0.4 (0.2, 1.0) 0.51 (0.15, 1.71) 0.277 Response defined : CR, PR 95% CI calculated using wilson method compared Placebo
code: # Create response rate table for tumor response # Note: adrs_onco uses ARM for treatment groups response_table <- create_responder_table(   data = adrs,   response_var = "AVALC",   response_values = c("CR", "PR"),  # CR + PR = Overall Response Rate   trt_var = "ARM",   title = "Best Overall Response Rate" )  # Display the table response_table@flextable

title: Creating Efficacy Tables
text: Response Rate Summary (Risk Ratio) Treatment n/N Rate (%) 95% CI RR (95% CI) p-value Placebo 8/1042 0.8 (0.4, 1.5) Reference - Screen Failure 0/624 0.0 (0.0, 0.6) 0.10 (0.01, 1.70) 0.029 Xanomeline High Dose 3/1016 0.3 (0.1, 0.9) 0.38 (0.10, 1.45) 0.226 Xanomeline Low Dose 4/1012 0.4 (0.2, 1.0) 0.51 (0.16, 1.70) 0.387 Response defined : CR, PR 95% CI calculated using wilson method RR compared Placebo
code: # Response table using risk ratio instead of odds ratio response_rr <- create_responder_table(   data = adrs,   response_var = "AVALC",   response_values = c("CR", "PR"),   trt_var = "ARM",   comparison_type = "RR",  # Risk Ratio   ci_method = "wilson",    # Wilson confidence interval   title = "Response Rate Summary (Risk Ratio)" )  # Display the table response_rr@flextable

title: Creating Efficacy Tables
text: Response Rate Difference Treatment n/N Rate (%) 95% CI RD (95% CI) p-value Placebo 8/1042 0.8 (0.4, 1.5) Reference - Screen Failure 0/624 0.0 (0.0, 0.6) -0.8 (-1.3, -0.2) 0.005 Xanomeline High Dose 3/1016 0.3 (0.1, 0.9) -0.5 (-1.1, 0.2) 0.139 Xanomeline Low Dose 4/1012 0.4 (0.2, 1.0) -0.4 (-1.0, 0.3) 0.266 Response defined : CR, PR 95% CI calculated using wilson method RD compared Placebo
code: # Response table with risk difference response_rd <- create_responder_table(   data = adrs,   response_var = "AVALC",   response_values = c("CR", "PR"),   trt_var = "ARM",   comparison_type = "RD",  # Risk Difference   title = "Response Rate Difference" )  # Display the table response_rd@flextable

title: Creating Efficacy Tables
text: Subgroup analyses show treatment effects across patient populations.

title: Creating Efficacy Tables
text: Subgroup Analysis - Overall Survival Subgroup Category n (Placebo) n (Xanomeline High Dose) HR (95% CI) Interaction p Overall  174 338 0.84 (0.20, 3.53)  Sex F 107 181 1.49 (0.21, 10.61) 0.249 Sex M 67 157 0.47 (0.05, 4.62)  HR = Hazard Ratio Reference group: Placebo Interaction p-value likelihood ratio test NE = Estimable
code: # Create subgroup analysis table subgroup_table <- create_subgroup_table(   data = adtte,   subgroups = list(     SEX = "Sex"   ),   endpoint_type = "tte",  # Time-to-event endpoint   trt_var = "ARM",   title = "Subgroup Analysis - Overall Survival" )  # Display the table subgroup_table@flextable

title: Creating Efficacy Tables
code: # Create forest plot for subgroup analysis forest_plot <- create_forest_plot(   data = adtte,   subgroups = list(     SEX = "Sex"   ),   endpoint_type = "tte",   trt_var = "ARM",   title = "Treatment Effect by Subgroup",   show_interaction = TRUE ) forest_plot@plot

text: Response Rate Subgroup Subgroup Category n (Placebo) n (Screen Failure) (95% CI) Interaction p Overall  1042 2652 0.00 (0.00, Inf)  Sex F 639 1517 0.00 (0.00, Inf) 0.009 Sex M 403 1135 0.00 (0.00, Inf)  = Odds Ratio Reference group: Placebo Interaction p-value likelihood ratio test NE = Estimable

title: Creating Efficacy Tables

title: Creating Efficacy Tables
text: Combine multiple analyses report:
code: generate_efficacy_report <- function(output_path = "Efficacy_Report.docx") {    # Get treatment counts for denominators   trt_n <- adsl |>     filter(SAFFL == "Y") |>     group_by(TRT01P) |>     summarise(N = n(), .groups = "drop")    # Section 1: Primary Endpoint Summary   primary_content <- create_primary_endpoint_table(     advs = advs,     trt_n = trt_n,     paramcd = "SYSBP",     visit = "End of Treatment",     title = "Table 3.1: Primary Endpoint Summary (Systolic BP)"   )    # Section 2: Change from Baseline   cfb_content <- create_cfb_summary_table(     advs = advs,     trt_n = trt_n,     params = c("SYSBP", "DIABP", "PULSE"),     visit = "End of Treatment",     title = "Table 3.2: Change from Baseline Summary"   )    # Section 3: Vital Signs by Visit   vs_content <- create_vs_by_visit_table(     advs = advs,     trt_n = trt_n,     paramcd = "SYSBP",     title = "Table 3.3: Vital Signs by Visit"   )    # Section 4: Laboratory Parameters   lab_content <- create_lab_summary_table(     adlb = adlb,     trt_n = trt_n,     title = "Table 3.4: Laboratory Parameters Summary"   )    # Section 5: Laboratory Shift Table   shift_content <- create_lab_shift_table(     adlb = adlb,     trt_n = trt_n,     paramcd = "ALT",     title = "Table 3.5: ALT Shift from Baseline"   )    # Section 6: Subgroup Analysis   subgroup_content <- create_subgroup_analysis_table(     adsl = adsl,     advs = advs,     title = "Table 3.6: Subgroup Analysis by Age Group"   )    # Create report sections   sections <- list(     ReportSection(       title = "Primary Endpoint Analysis",       section_type = "efficacy",       content = list(primary_content)     ),     ReportSection(       title = "Change from Baseline Analysis",       section_type = "efficacy",       content = list(cfb_content)     ),     ReportSection(       title = "Vital Signs by Study Visit",       section_type = "efficacy",       content = list(vs_content)     ),     ReportSection(       title = "Laboratory Parameters",       section_type = "efficacy",       content = list(lab_content)     ),     ReportSection(       title = "Laboratory Shift Analysis",       section_type = "efficacy",       content = list(shift_content)     ),     ReportSection(       title = "Subgroup Analyses",       section_type = "efficacy",       content = list(subgroup_content)     )   )    # Create and save report   report <- ClinicalReport(     study_id = "CDISCPILOT01",     study_title = "CDISC Pilot Study - Efficacy Report",     sections = sections,     metadata = list(       generated_at = Sys.time(),       package_version = as.character(packageVersion("pharmhand")),       data_source = "pharmaverseadam",       report_type = "efficacy"     )   )    # Generate Word document   generate_word(report, path = output_path)    cat("Efficacy report generated:", output_path, "\n")   invisible(report) }  # Generate the report generate_efficacy_report()

title: Get started with pharmhand
text: Wrap ADaM datasets ADaMData objects, create tables plots, assemble reports.

title: Get started with pharmhand
code: library(pharmhand)  adam_data <- ADaMData(   data = adsl,   domain = "ADSL",   population = "SAF",   trt_var = "TRT01A" )  adam_data@filtered_data  # Filtered to SAFFL == "Y" adam_data@trt_n          # Treatment group N's

title: Get started with pharmhand
code: demo_table <- create_demographics_table(   adsl_data = adam_data,   title = "Table 1.1: Demographics and Baseline Characteristics" )  demo_table@flextable    # Formatted flextable demo_table@metadata     # Analysis details

title: Get started with pharmhand
code: km_plot <- create_km_plot(   data = adtte,   time_var = "AVAL",   event_var = "CNSR",   trt_var = "TRT01P",   title = "Figure 1: Kaplan-Meier Plot of Overall Survival",   risk_table = TRUE,   show_median = TRUE )  km_plot@plot            # ggplot2/ggsurvplot object

title: Get started with pharmhand
code: report <- ClinicalReport(   study_id = "STUDY-001",   study_title = "Phase III Clinical Trial" )  efficacy_section <- ReportSection(   title = "Efficacy Results",   section_type = "efficacy" )  efficacy_section <- add_content(efficacy_section, demo_table) efficacy_section <- add_content(efficacy_section, km_plot) report <- add_section(report, efficacy_section)  generate_word(report, "clinical_study_report.docx")

title: Get started with pharmhand
text: vignette("baseline-tables") - Demographics, disposition, baseline characteristics vignette("safety-tables") - Safety tables adverse event analysis vignette("efficacy-tables") - Efficacy endpoints time--event analysis vignette("s7-architecture") - S7 class system extension points

title: Understanding the S7 Class Architecture
text: pharmhand uses S7 classes clinical data analysis reporting. vignette documents class system.

title: Understanding the S7 Class Architecture
text: S7 provides property validation, computed properties, multiple dispatch.

title: Understanding the S7 Class Architecture
text: pharmhand S7 architecture:
code: ClinicalContent (abstract) ├── ClinicalTable ├── ClinicalPlot └── ReportSection     ├── SOCPTSection     ├── PopulationSection     ├── SubgroupSection     └── HTASection  ADaMData ├── AnalysisResults ├── StudyResult ├── ClinicalReport └── AnalysisMeta  Study Design Classes ├── OneArmStudy └── TwoArmStudy  Endpoint Classes ├── PrimaryEndpoint ├── SecondaryEndpoint ├── SafetyEndpoint └── HTAEndpoint

title: Understanding the S7 Class Architecture
text: ADaMData wraps ADaM datasets metadata computed properties.

title: Understanding the S7 Class Architecture
code: library(pharmhand)  # Create a simple ADaM dataset demo_data <- data.frame(   USUBJID = paste0("SUBJ", 1:100),   TRT01P = sample(c("Placebo", "Active"), 100, replace = TRUE),   AGE = rnorm(100, mean = 65, sd = 12),   SEX = sample(c("M", "F"), 100, replace = TRUE),   ITTFL = "Y",   PPSFL = sample(c("Y", "N"), 100, prob = c(0.9, 0.1), replace = TRUE),   stringsAsFactors = FALSE )  # Create ADaMData object adam_data <- ADaMData(   data = demo_data,   domain = "ADSL",   population = "ITT",   trt_var = "TRT01P",   subject_var = "USUBJID" )  # Access properties adam_data@domain #> [1] "ADSL" adam_data@population #> [1] "ITT"

title: Understanding the S7 Class Architecture
text: ADaMData provides computed properties population filtering:
code: # Filtered data (respects population filter) head(adam_data@filtered_data) #>   USUBJID  TRT01P      AGE SEX ITTFL PPSFL #> 1   SUBJ1 Placebo 75.34504   F     Y     Y #> 2   SUBJ2 Placebo 62.08116   M     Y     Y #> 3   SUBJ3  Active 62.52695   M     Y     N #> 4   SUBJ4 Placebo 65.23013   F     Y     Y #> 5   SUBJ5 Placebo 65.35473   F     Y     Y #> 6   SUBJ6  Active 71.59793   F     Y     Y  # Treatment group counts trt_counts <- adam_data@trt_n trt_counts #> # A tibble: 2 × 2 #>   TRT01P      N #>   <chr>   <int> #> 1 Active     49 #> 2 Placebo    51

title: Understanding the S7 Class Architecture
code: # Switch to Per Protocol Set adam_pps <- ADaMData(   data = demo_data,   domain = "ADSL",   population = "PPS"  # Uses PPSFL column )  # Compare population sizes nrow(adam_data@filtered_data)  # ITT: all subjects #> [1] 100 nrow(adam_pps@filtered_data)   # PPS: only PPSFL == "Y" #> [1] 92  # Use "ALL" to bypass population filtering adam_all <- ADaMData(   data = demo_data,   domain = "ADSL",   population = "ALL" ) nrow(adam_all@filtered_data)  # All 100 subjects #> [1] 100

title: Understanding the S7 Class Architecture
text: ClinicalTable represents formatted clinical tables.

title: Understanding the S7 Class Architecture
code: # Create a simple clinical table table_data <- data.frame(   Parameter = c("Age (years)", "Sex: Male", "Sex: Female"),   Statistic = c("65.2 ± 11.8", "52 (52%)", "48 (48%)"),   stringsAsFactors = FALSE )  clinical_table <- ClinicalTable(   data = table_data,   type = "demographics",   title = "Baseline Demographics" )  # Access computed properties clinical_table@n_rows #> [1] 3 clinical_table@column_names #> [1] "Parameter" "Statistic"

title: Understanding the S7 Class Architecture
code: # Perform baseline analysis baseline_results <- calculate_baseline(adam_data, vars = c("AGE", "SEX"))  # Convert to ClinicalTable with flextable clinical_table <- ClinicalTable(   data = baseline_results@stats,   flextable = flextable::flextable(baseline_results@stats),   type = "baseline",   title = "Baseline Characteristics" )  # Access the flextable class(clinical_table@flextable) #> [1] "flextable"

title: Understanding the S7 Class Architecture
text: Access flextable styling:
code: ft <- clinical_table@flextable class(ft) #> [1] "flextable"

title: Understanding the S7 Class Architecture
text: ClinicalPlot wraps ggplot2 objects metadata export capabilities.

title: Understanding the S7 Class Architecture
code: library(ggplot2)  # Create a simple scatter plot sex_numeric <- as.numeric(factor(demo_data$SEX, levels = c("M", "F"))) p <- ggplot(demo_data, aes(x = AGE, y = sex_numeric)) +   geom_point(alpha = 0.6) +   labs(x = "Age (years)", y = "Sex (M=1, F=2)")  # Wrap in ClinicalPlot clinical_plot <- ClinicalPlot(   plot = p,   type = "scatter",   title = "Age Distribution by Sex",   width = 6,   height = 4,   dpi = 300 )  # Access plot properties clinical_plot@width #> [1] 6 clinical_plot@height #> [1] 4 clinical_plot@type #> [1] "scatter"

title: Understanding the S7 Class Architecture
code: # For survival plots, is_survival property is automatically detected clinical_plot@is_survival  # FALSE for our scatter plot #> [1] FALSE

title: Understanding the S7 Class Architecture
text: Save plots multiple formats:
code: # Save as different formats png_path <- save_plot_as(clinical_plot, format = "png") pdf_path <- save_plot_as(clinical_plot, format = "pdf")  # Files are created with specified dimensions and DPI file.exists(png_path) #> [1] TRUE file.exists(pdf_path) #> [1] TRUE

title: Understanding the S7 Class Architecture
text: ClinicalReport represents complete report sections.

title: Understanding the S7 Class Architecture
code: # Create a basic report structure report <- ClinicalReport(   study_id = "STUDY-001",   study_title = "Phase III Clinical Study",   metadata = list(     protocol_version = "1.0",     analysis_date = Sys.Date()   ) )  # Add sections baseline_section <- ReportSection(   title = "Baseline Characteristics",   section_type = "baseline" )  safety_section <- ReportSection(   title = "Safety Analysis",   section_type = "safety" )  # Add sections to report report@sections <- list(   baseline = baseline_section,   safety = safety_section )  report@n_sections #> [1] 2

title: Understanding the S7 Class Architecture
code: # SOC-PT section for adverse events ae_section <- SOCPTSection(   title = "Adverse Events by System Organ Class",   soc_var = "AEBODSYS",   pt_var = "AEDECOD",   group_var = "TRT01P" )  # Population analysis section pop_section <- PopulationSection(   title = "Population Analysis",   pop_var = "FASFL",   group_var = "TRT01P" )  # Subgroup analysis section subgroup_section <- SubgroupSection(   title = "Subgroup Analysis",   subgroup_var = "AGEGR1",   group_var = "TRT01P" )

title: Understanding the S7 Class Architecture
text: pharmhand provides specialized classes different study designs.

title: Understanding the S7 Class Architecture
code: one_arm_data <- data.frame(   USUBJID = paste0("SUBJ", 1:50),   TRT01P = "Active",  # Single treatment   AGE = rnorm(50, mean = 60, sd = 10),   RESPONSE = sample(c("Y", "N"), 50, prob = c(0.3, 0.7), replace = TRUE),   AEBODSYS = sample(c("GI", "CNS", "Respiratory"), 50, replace = TRUE),   AEDECOD = sample(c("Nausea", "Headache", "Cough"), 50, replace = TRUE),   stringsAsFactors = FALSE )  one_arm_study <- OneArmStudy(   data = one_arm_data,   study_id = "ONE-ARM-001",   study_title = "Single-Arm Oncology Study" )  # Analyze the study one_arm_study <- analyze_study(one_arm_study)  # Results are stored in the study object names(one_arm_study@results) #> [1] "baseline" "safety"

title: Understanding the S7 Class Architecture
code: two_arm_data <- data.frame(   USUBJID = paste0("SUBJ", 1:100),   TRT01P = sample(c("Placebo", "Active"), 100, replace = TRUE),   AGE = rnorm(100, mean = 65, sd = 12),   RESPONSE = sample(c("Y", "N"), 100, prob = c(0.4, 0.6), replace = TRUE),   AEBODSYS = sample(c("GI", "CNS", "Respiratory"), 100, replace = TRUE),   AEDECOD = sample(c("Nausea", "Headache", "Cough"), 100, replace = TRUE),   stringsAsFactors = FALSE )  two_arm_study <- TwoArmStudy(   data = two_arm_data,   group_var = "TRT01P",   study_id = "TWO-ARM-001",   study_title = "Randomized Controlled Trial" )  # Analyze the comparative study two_arm_study <- analyze_study(two_arm_study) names(two_arm_study@results) #> [1] "baseline" "safety"

title: Understanding the S7 Class Architecture
text: pharmhand uses S7’s multiple dispatch system.

title: Understanding the S7 Class Architecture
code: # analyze() - performs analysis based on input type baseline_results <- analyze(adam_data)  # ADaMData method  # as_flextable() - converts to flextable format ft <- as_flextable(baseline_results)  # AnalysisResults method  # as_gt() - converts to gt format gt_tbl <- as_gt(baseline_results)     # AnalysisResults method  # to_word() - converts to Word-compatible format word_obj <- to_word(clinical_table)   # ClinicalTable method

title: Understanding the S7 Class Architecture
code: # Single dispatch on first argument analyze(adam_data)           # Uses ADaMData method #> <pharmhand::AnalysisResults> #>  @ stats    : tibble [2 × 2] (S3: tbl_df/tbl/data.frame) #>  $ TRT01P: chr [1:2] "Active" "Placebo" #>  $ N     : int [1:2] 49 51 #>  @ type     : chr "baseline" #>  @ groupings: list() #>  @ metadata : list() analyze_study(one_arm_study) # Uses OneArmStudy method #> <pharmhand::OneArmStudy> #>  @ data       :'data.frame': 50 obs. of  6 variables: #>  .. $ USUBJID : chr  "SUBJ1" "SUBJ2" "SUBJ3" "SUBJ4" ... #>  .. $ TRT01P  : chr  "Active" "Active" "Active" "Active" ... #>  .. $ AGE     : num  51.7 55 48.1 52.5 74.6 ... #>  .. $ RESPONSE: chr  "N" "N" "N" "N" ... #>  .. $ AEBODSYS: chr  "GI" "CNS" "GI" "CNS" ... #>  .. $ AEDECOD : chr  "Nausea" "Nausea" "Nausea" "Headache" ... #>  @ study_id   : chr "ONE-ARM-001" #>  @ study_title: chr "Single-Arm Oncology Study" #>  @ results    :List of 2 #>  .. $ baseline: <pharmhand::AnalysisResults> #>  ..  ..@ stats    : tibble [1 × 8] (S3: tbl_df/tbl/data.frame) #>  $ variable: chr "AGE" #>  $ TRT01P  : chr "Active" #>  $ n       : int 50 #>  $ mean    : num 60.4 #>  $ sd      : num 10.6 #>  $ median  : num 60 #>  $ min     : num 38.2 #>  $ max     : num 81.6 #>  ..  ..@ type     : chr "baseline" #>  ..  ..@ groupings: list() #>  ..  ..@ metadata :List of 1 #>  .. .. .. $ categorical: tibble [8 × 4] (S3: tbl_df/tbl/data.frame) #>  .. .. ..  ..$ variable: chr [1:8] "AEBODSYS" "AEBODSYS" "AEBODSYS" "AEDECOD" ... #>  .. .. ..  ..$ TRT01P  : chr [1:8] "Active" "Active" "Active" "Active" ... #>  .. .. ..  ..$ n       : int [1:8] 15 17 18 18 13 19 35 15 #>  .. .. ..  ..$ label   : chr [1:8] "CNS (n=15, 30%)" "GI (n=17, 34%)" "Respiratory (n=18, 36%)" "Cough (n=18, 36%)" ... #>  .. $ safety  : <pharmhand::AnalysisResults> #>  ..  ..@ stats    : tibble [12 × 8] (S3: tbl_df/tbl/data.frame) #>  $ AEBODSYS: chr [1:12] "CNS" "CNS" "CNS" "CNS" ... #>  $ TRT01P  : chr [1:12] "Active" "Active" "Active" "Active" ... #>  $ n       : int [1:12] 15 8 3 4 17 4 5 8 18 6 ... #>  $ N_tot   : int [1:12] 50 50 50 50 50 50 50 50 50 50 ... #>  $ pct     : num [1:12] 30 16 6 8 34 8 10 16 36 12 ... #>  $ level   : chr [1:12] "SOC" "PT" "PT" "PT" ... #>  $ label   : chr [1:12] "CNS" "Cough" "Headache" "Nausea" ... #>  $ AEDECOD : chr [1:12] NA "Cough" "Headache" "Nausea" ... #>  ..  ..@ type     : chr "safety_ae" #>  ..  ..@ groupings: list() #>  ..  ..@ metadata : list() #>  @ metadata   : list()  # Multiple dispatch - method selected based on content type doc <- officer::read_docx()  # Create simple objects for demonstration simple_df <- data.frame(Var = c("A", "B"), Value = c("1.2", "3.4")) table_obj <- ClinicalTable(   data = simple_df,   flextable = flextable::flextable(simple_df),   type = "simple" )  plot_obj <- ClinicalPlot(   plot = ggplot2::ggplot(data.frame(x = 1:5, y = 1:5),                          ggplot2::aes(x = x, y = y)) +     ggplot2::geom_point(),   title = "Demo Plot" )  # Different methods based on second argument type doc <- add_to_docx(doc, table_obj)  # Uses ClinicalTable method doc <- add_to_docx(doc, plot_obj)   # Uses ClinicalPlot method

title: Understanding the S7 Class Architecture
code: # Add content to StudyResult study_result <- StudyResult(   study_id = "TEST-001",   study_title = "Test Study" )  # Create a fresh clinical table for this example table_data <- data.frame(   Variable = c("Age", "Sex"),   Statistic = c("Mean (SD)", "n (%)"),   Value = c("60.5 (10.2)", "50 (50%)") ) clinical_table <- ClinicalTable(   data = table_data,   type = "demographics",   title = "Demographics" )  # Create a fresh clinical plot for this example clinical_plot <- ClinicalPlot(   plot = ggplot2::ggplot(data.frame(x = 1:10, y = 1:10),                           ggplot2::aes(x = x, y = y)) +     ggplot2::geom_line(),   title = "Sample Plot" )  # Add table with automatic naming study_result <- add_table(study_result, clinical_table, name = "demographics")  # Add plot with automatic naming study_result <- add_plot(study_result, clinical_plot, name = "efficacy_plot")  # Content is automatically tracked study_result@table_names #> [1] "demographics" study_result@plot_names #> [1] "efficacy_plot"

title: Understanding the S7 Class Architecture
text: pharmhand provides endpoint classes different analyses.

title: Understanding the S7 Class Architecture
code: # Primary endpoint primary_endpoint <- PrimaryEndpoint(   name = "Overall Survival",   variable = "OS",   type = "time_to_event",   description = "Time from randomization to death from any cause",   hypothesis = "superiority",   alpha = 0.05 )  # Secondary endpoint secondary_endpoint <- SecondaryEndpoint(   name = "Progression-Free Survival",   variable = "PFS",   type = "time_to_event",   description = "Time from randomization to disease progression or death",   priority = 1,   exploratory = FALSE )

title: Understanding the S7 Class Architecture
code: safety_endpoint <- SafetyEndpoint(   name = "Serious Adverse Events",   variable = "AESER",   type = "adverse_event",   description = "Incidence of serious adverse events",   severity = "serious",   relatedness = "related" )

title: Understanding the S7 Class Architecture
code: hta_endpoint <- HTAEndpoint(   name = "Response Rate",   variable = "AVALC",   type = "binary",   description = "Objective response rate per RECIST v1.1",   strata = c("AGEGR1", "SEX"),   criteria = list(     measurable_disease = "MEASUR == 'Y'",     baseline_scan = "BLSCAN == 'Y'"   ) )

title: Understanding the S7 Class Architecture
text: AnalysisMeta provides audit trail capabilities.

title: Understanding the S7 Class Architecture
code: # Manual creation meta <- AnalysisMeta(   source_vars = c("AGE", "SEX", "HEIGHT"),   filters = list(     population = "ITTFL == 'Y'",     baseline = "ABLFL == 'Y'"   ),   row_id = "demographics_age_mean",   derivation = "Mean age calculated using available baseline measurements",   timestamp = Sys.time(),   package_version = as.character(packageVersion("pharmhand")),   r_version = paste0(R.version$major, ".", R.version$minor) )  # Helper function for common cases meta_auto <- create_analysis_meta(   source_vars = c("AGE", "SEX"),   derivation = "Mean ± SD for continuous, n (%) for categorical",   row_id = "baseline_summary" )

title: Understanding the S7 Class Architecture
text: S7 architecture makes easy extend pharmhand.

title: Understanding the S7 Class Architecture
code: # Create a custom endpoint type custom_endpoint <- S7::new_class(   "CustomEndpoint",   package = "myextension",   parent = PrimaryEndpoint,   properties = list(     custom_param = S7::new_property(       S7::class_numeric,       validator = function(value) {         if (any(value < 0)) return("custom_param must be non-negative")         NULL       }     )   ) )

title: Understanding the S7 Class Architecture
code: # Add a method to an existing generic S7::method(analyze, custom_endpoint) <- function(x, data, ...) {   # Custom analysis logic here   results <- list(     estimate = mean(data[[x@variable]]),     custom_value = x@custom_param   )    AnalysisResults(     stats = as.data.frame(results),     type = "custom_analysis",     metadata = list(endpoint = x@name)   ) }

title: Understanding the S7 Class Architecture
code: # Add a custom variable for demonstration demo_data$CUSTOM_VAR <- rnorm(nrow(demo_data), mean = 100, sd = 15)  # Custom endpoint works with standard generics custom_endpoint_obj <- custom_endpoint(   name = "Custom Analysis",   variable = "CUSTOM_VAR",   type = "custom",   custom_param = 42 )  # Analysis results can be converted to standard formats custom_results <- analyze(custom_endpoint_obj, data = demo_data) ft <- as_flextable(custom_results)

title: Understanding the S7 Class Architecture
code: validated_class <- S7::new_class(   "ValidatedClass",   properties = list(     critical_value = S7::new_property(       S7::class_numeric,       validator = function(value) {         if (length(value) != 1) return("Must be single value")         if (value < 0 || value > 1) return("Must be between 0 and 1")         NULL       }     )   ) )

title: Understanding the S7 Class Architecture
code: smart_class <- S7::new_class(   "SmartClass",   properties = list(     data = S7::new_property(S7::class_data.frame),     n_complete = S7::new_property(       S7::class_integer,       getter = function(self) sum(complete.cases(self@data))     )   ) )

title: Creating Safety Tables

title: Creating Safety Tables
code: # Create multiple safety tables safety_tables <- list(   overview = create_ae_table(adae, adsl, type = "overview"),   soc = create_ae_table(adae, adsl, type = "soc"),   common = create_ae_table(adae, adsl, type = "common", n_top = 10),   sae = create_ae_table(adae, adsl, type = "sae") )  # Create report sections safety_sections <- lapply(names(safety_tables), function(table_name) {   ReportSection(     title = paste("Safety Analysis:", table_name),     section_type = "safety",     content = list(safety_tables[[table_name]])   ) })  # Create clinical report safety_report <- ClinicalReport(   study_id = "CDISCPILOT01",   study_title = "Safety Analysis Report",   sections = safety_sections )  # Export to Word # generate_word(safety_report, path = "safety_report.docx")  cat("Safety report structure created with", length(safety_tables), "tables.") #> Safety report structure created with 4 tables. cat("\nUse generate_word() to export to Word.") #>  #> Use generate_word() to export to Word.

code: # Calculate time-to-event data for a specific SOC tte_data <- calculate_ae_tte_data(   adsl = adsl,   adae = adae,   soc = "Skin and subcutaneous tissue disorders" )  # Preview TTE data structure head(tte_data, 3) #> # A tibble: 3 × 57 #>   STUDYID      USUBJID SUBJID RFSTDTC RFENDTC RFXSTDTC RFXENDTC RFICDTC RFPENDTC #>   <chr>        <chr>   <chr>  <chr>   <chr>   <chr>    <chr>    <chr>   <chr>    #> 1 CDISCPILOT01 01-701… 1015   2014-0… 2014-0… 2014-01… 2014-07… NA      2014-07… #> 2 CDISCPILOT01 01-701… 1023   2012-0… 2012-0… 2012-08… 2012-09… NA      2013-02… #> 3 CDISCPILOT01 01-701… 1028   2013-0… 2014-0… 2013-07… 2014-01… NA      2014-01… #> # ℹ 48 more variables: DTHDTC <chr>, DTHFL <chr>, SITEID <chr>, AGE <dbl>, #> #   AGEU <chr>, SEX <chr>, RACE <chr>, ETHNIC <chr>, ARMCD <chr>, ARM <chr>, #> #   ACTARMCD <chr>, ACTARM <chr>, COUNTRY <chr>, DMDTC <chr>, DMDY <dbl>, #> #   TRT01P <chr>, TRT01A <chr>, TRTSDTM <dttm>, TRTSTMF <chr>, TRTEDTM <dttm>, #> #   TRTETMF <chr>, TRTSDT <date>, TRTEDT <date>, TRTDURD <dbl>, SCRFDT <date>, #> #   EOSDT <date>, EOSSTT <chr>, FRVDT <date>, RANDDT <date>, DTHDT <date>, #> #   DTHDTF <chr>, DTHADY <dbl>, LDDTHELD <dbl>, DTHCAUS <chr>, DTHDOM <chr>, …  # Create KM plot km_plot <- create_ae_km_plot_for_soc(   adsl = adsl,   adae = adae,   soc = "Skin and subcutaneous tissue disorders" )  print(km_plot@plot)

title: Creating Safety Tables
text: GBA/AMNOG dossiers, comparing adverse event rates treatment groups risk differences risk ratios essential. create_ae_comparison_table() function provides statistics.

title: Creating Safety Tables
code: # Create AE comparison table with risk differences comparison_table <- create_ae_table(   adae = adae,   adsl = adsl,   type = "comparison",   ref_group = "Placebo",   by = "soc",   title = "Table: AE Comparison by System Organ Class" )  # Display the table comparison_table@flextable

title: Creating Safety Tables
code: # Compare at preferred term level with threshold pt_comparison <- create_ae_comparison_table(   adae = adae,   adsl = adsl,   ref_group = "Placebo",   by = "pt",   threshold = 5,  # Only events with ≥5% incidence   sort_by = "rd",  # Sort by risk difference   title = "AEs with ≥5% Incidence - Sorted by Risk Difference" )  # Display the table pt_comparison@flextable

title: Creating Safety Tables
text: Overall TEAE Comparison Term Placebon/N (%) Xanomeline High Dosen/N (%) RD(95% CI) RR(95% CI) P-value Xanomeline Low Dosen/N (%) TEAE 65/86 (75.6%) 75/84 (89.3%) 16.1% (5.3%, 26.9%) 1.21 (1.06, 1.39) 0.005 77/84 (91.7%) Safety Population RD = Risk Difference, RR = Risk Ratio, CI = 95% Confidence Interval Reference group: Placebo P-values Chi-square (Fisher's exact expected count < 5)
code: # Overall comparison (any TEAE) overall_comparison <- create_ae_comparison_table(   adae = adae,   adsl = adsl,   ref_group = "Placebo",   by = "overall",   title = "Overall TEAE Comparison" )  # Display the table overall_comparison@flextable

title: Creating Safety Tables
text: Risk Difference > 0: Higher incidence treatment vs reference Risk Ratio > 1: Higher relative risk treatment vs reference P-value < 0.05: Statistically significant difference (unadjusted) GBA submissions, risk difference often primary measure reflects absolute impact patients.

what: pharmhand: Clinical Study Tables and Reports
title: pharmhand: Clinical Study Tables and Reports
text: pharmhand creates clinical study tables reports ADaM datasets. uses S7 classes structure clinical data outputs formatted tables plots Word documents.

title: pharmhand: Clinical Study Tables and Reports
code: # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("sims1253/pharmhand")

title: pharmhand: Clinical Study Tables and Reports
code: library(pharmhand)  # Wrap ADaM data with automatic population filtering adam_data <- ADaMData(   data = adsl,   domain = "ADSL",    population = "SAF",   trt_var = "TRT01A" )  # Access filtered data and treatment counts directly adam_data@filtered_data  # Auto-filtered to SAFFL == "Y" adam_data@trt_n          # Treatment group N's computed automatically

title: pharmhand: Clinical Study Tables and Reports
code: # Time-to-event summary with median, HR, and landmarks tte_table <- create_tte_summary_table(   adtte,   time_var = "AVAL",   event_var = "CNSR",   trt_var = "TRT01A",   landmarks = c(6, 12)  # Survival rates at 6 and 12 months )  # Responder analysis with CI, OR, RR, RD responder_table <- create_responder_table(   adrs,   response_var = "AVALC",   trt_var = "TRT01A",   effect_measure = "OR" )  # Subgroup analysis table for Word export subgroup_table <- create_subgroup_table(   adtte,   subgroups = list(     "Age" = list(var = "AGEGR1"),     "Sex" = list(var = "SEX")   ),   effect_type = "hr" )

title: pharmhand: Clinical Study Tables and Reports
code: # AE Overview create_ae_table(adae, adsl, type = "overview")  # AEs by SOC create_ae_table(adae, adsl, type = "soc")  # Most common AEs (top 15) create_ae_table(adae, adsl, type = "common", n_top = 15)  # SAEs, discontinuations, deaths create_ae_table(adae, adsl, type = "sae") create_ae_table(adae, adsl, type = "discontinuation") create_ae_table(adae, adsl, type = "deaths")  # By severity or relationship create_ae_table(adae, adsl, type = "severity") create_ae_table(adae, adsl, type = "relationship")

title: pharmhand: Clinical Study Tables and Reports
code: # Kaplan-Meier with risk table km_plot <- create_km_plot(   data = adtte,   time_var = "AVAL",   event_var = "CNSR",   trt_var = "TRT01A",   risk_table = TRUE,   show_median = TRUE,   landmarks = c(12, 24) )  # Forest plot for subgroup analysis forest_plot <- create_forest_plot(   data = adtte,   subgroups = list(     "Age <65" = list(var = "AGEGR1", level = "<65"),     "Age >=65" = list(var = "AGEGR1", level = ">=65")   ),   effect_type = "hr" )

title: pharmhand: Clinical Study Tables and Reports
code: # Build a complete report report <- ClinicalReport(   study_id = "STUDY-001",   study_title = "Phase III Clinical Trial" )  section <- ReportSection(   title = "Efficacy Results",   section_type = "efficacy" )  section <- add_content(section, tte_table) section <- add_content(section, km_plot) report <- add_section(report, section)  # Export to Word generate_word(report, "study_report.docx")

what: Add SMD Column to Demographics/Baseline Table — add_smd_to_table
title: Add SMD Column to Demographics/Baseline Table — add_smd_to_table
text: Adds standardized mean difference column baseline characteristics table, flagging variables exceed imbalance threshold. essential GBA/AMNOG dossiers demonstrate baseline comparability.

title: Add SMD Column to Demographics/Baseline Table — add_smd_to_table
code: add_smd_to_table(   data,   trt_var,   vars,   ref_group = NULL,   threshold = 0.1,   conf_level = 0.95,   flag_symbol = "*" )

title: Add SMD Column to Demographics/Baseline Table — add_smd_to_table
text: data data frame containing baseline data. trt_var Character. Name treatment variable. vars Character vector. Names variables calculate SMD . ref_group Character NULL. Reference (control) group value. NULL, uses first level. threshold Numeric. SMD threshold flagging imbalance (default: 0.1). Common thresholds 0.1 (strict) 0.25 (lenient). conf_level Numeric. Confidence level CI (default: 0.95) flag_symbol Character. Symbol use flagging imbalanced variables (default: "*")

title: Add SMD Column to Demographics/Baseline Table — add_smd_to_table
text: data frame columns: variable: Variable name smd: Standardized mean difference ci: Formatted confidence interval imbalanced: Logical flag |SMD| > threshold smd_display: Formatted SMD flag imbalanced

title: Add SMD Column to Demographics/Baseline Table — add_smd_to_table
text: IQWiG (2020). General Methods: Version 6.0. Institute Quality Efficiency Health Care.

title: Add SMD Column to Demographics/Baseline Table — add_smd_to_table
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ adsl <- data.frame(   AGE = rnorm(200, 55, 12),   WEIGHT = rnorm(200, 75, 15),   SEX = sample(c("M", "F"), 200, replace = TRUE),   TRT01P = rep(c("Treatment", "Placebo"), each = 100) )  smd_table <- add_smd_to_table(   data = adsl,   trt_var = "TRT01P",   vars = c("AGE", "WEIGHT", "SEX"),   ref_group = "Placebo" ) } # }

what: Adjust P-values for Multiple Comparisons — adjust_pvalues
title: Adjust P-values for Multiple Comparisons — adjust_pvalues
text: Adjusts p-values multiple testing using common methods. Essential subgroup analyses GBA/AMNOG dossiers multiple comparisons require appropriate correction.

title: Adjust P-values for Multiple Comparisons — adjust_pvalues
code: adjust_pvalues(   p,   method = c("holm", "hochberg", "hommel", "bonferroni", "BH", "fdr", "BY", "none"),   alpha = 0.05 )

title: Adjust P-values for Multiple Comparisons — adjust_pvalues
text: p Numeric vector p-values method Character. Adjustment method: "holm" (default): Holm-Bonferroni step-(controls FWER) "hochberg": Hochberg step-(controls FWER) "hommel": Hommel method (controls FWER) "bonferroni": Bonferroni correction (controls FWER, conservative) "BH" "fdr": Benjamini-Hochberg (controls FDR) "": Benjamini-Yekutieli (controls FDR dependency) "none": adjustment alpha Numeric. Significance level (default: 0.05)

title: Adjust P-values for Multiple Comparisons — adjust_pvalues
text: data frame columns: original_p: Original p-values adjusted_p: Adjusted p-values significant_original: Logical original significance significant_adjusted: Logical adjusted significance method: Adjustment method used

title: Adjust P-values for Multiple Comparisons — adjust_pvalues
text: FWER methods control probability making false rejection. FDR methods control expected proportion false rejections. GBA submissions, Holm Hochberg methods commonly recommended control FWER less conservative Bonferroni.

title: Adjust P-values for Multiple Comparisons — adjust_pvalues
code: # Adjust p-values from multiple subgroup comparisons p_values <- c(0.01, 0.04, 0.03, 0.15, 0.008) adjust_pvalues(p_values, method = "holm") #>   original_p adjusted_p significant_original significant_adjusted method #> 1      0.010       0.04                 TRUE                 TRUE   holm #> 2      0.040       0.09                 TRUE                FALSE   holm #> 3      0.030       0.09                 TRUE                FALSE   holm #> 4      0.150       0.15                FALSE                FALSE   holm #> 5      0.008       0.04                 TRUE                 TRUE   holm  # Compare different adjustment methods adjust_pvalues(p_values, method = "bonferroni") #>   original_p adjusted_p significant_original significant_adjusted     method #> 1      0.010       0.05                 TRUE                FALSE bonferroni #> 2      0.040       0.20                 TRUE                FALSE bonferroni #> 3      0.030       0.15                 TRUE                FALSE bonferroni #> 4      0.150       0.75                FALSE                FALSE bonferroni #> 5      0.008       0.04                 TRUE                 TRUE bonferroni adjust_pvalues(p_values, method = "BH") #>   original_p adjusted_p significant_original significant_adjusted method #> 1      0.010      0.025                 TRUE                 TRUE     BH #> 2      0.040      0.050                 TRUE                FALSE     BH #> 3      0.030      0.050                 TRUE                FALSE     BH #> 4      0.150      0.150                FALSE                FALSE     BH #> 5      0.008      0.025                 TRUE                 TRUE     BH  # With custom significance level adjust_pvalues(p_values, method = "holm", alpha = 0.10) #>   original_p adjusted_p significant_original significant_adjusted method #> 1      0.010       0.04                 TRUE                 TRUE   holm #> 2      0.040       0.09                 TRUE                 TRUE   holm #> 3      0.030       0.09                 TRUE                 TRUE   holm #> 4      0.150       0.15                FALSE                FALSE   holm #> 5      0.008       0.04                 TRUE                 TRUE   holm

what: Assess Baseline Balance Between Treatment Groups — assess_baseline_balance
title: Assess Baseline Balance Between Treatment Groups — assess_baseline_balance
text: Performs comprehensive baseline balance assessment calculating SMD multiple continuous categorical variables. Returns BalanceAssessment object includes SMD results, imbalance flags, summary statistics, data formatted Love plot visualization.

title: Assess Baseline Balance Between Treatment Groups — assess_baseline_balance
code: assess_baseline_balance(   data,   trt_var,   continuous_vars = character(),   categorical_vars = character(),   ref_group = NULL,   threshold = 0.1,   conf_level = 0.95,   continuous_method = c("cohens_d", "hedges_g"),   categorical_method = c("arcsine", "logit", "raw") )

title: Assess Baseline Balance Between Treatment Groups — assess_baseline_balance
text: data data frame containing baseline data. trt_var Character. Name treatment variable. continuous_vars Character vector. Names continuous variables. categorical_vars Character vector. Names categorical variables. ref_group Character NULL. Reference (control) group value. threshold Numeric. SMD threshold imbalance (default: 0.1). conf_level Numeric. Confidence level CIs (default: 0.95). continuous_method Character. SMD method continuous variables. One "cohens_d" (default) "hedges_g". categorical_method Character. SMD method categorical variables. One "arcsine" (default), "logit", "raw".

title: Assess Baseline Balance Between Treatment Groups — assess_baseline_balance
text: BalanceAssessment S7 object : smd_results: Data frame SMD variable imbalanced_vars: Character vector imbalanced variable names threshold: threshold used n_treatment: Sample size treatment group n_control: Sample size control group summary_stats: List summary statistics love_plot_data: Data frame formatted Love plot

title: Assess Baseline Balance Between Treatment Groups — assess_baseline_balance
text: threshold 0.1 commonly used clinical trials indicate meaningful imbalance. Variables |SMD| > threshold flagged. IQWiG (German HTA agency) recommends SMD assessment baseline characteristics benefit assessment dossiers.

title: Assess Baseline Balance Between Treatment Groups — assess_baseline_balance
text: Austin, P. C. (2009). Balance diagnostics comparing distribution baseline covariates treatment groups propensity-score matched samples. Statistics Medicine, 28(25), 3083-3107.

title: Assess Baseline Balance Between Treatment Groups — assess_baseline_balance
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Assess baseline balance balance <- assess_baseline_balance(   data = adsl,   trt_var = "TRT01P",   continuous_vars = c("AGE", "WEIGHT", "HEIGHT", "BMI"),   categorical_vars = c("SEX", "RACE", "ETHNIC"),   ref_group = "Placebo",   threshold = 0.1 )  # Check if balanced balance@balanced  # View imbalanced variables balance@imbalanced_vars  # Create Love plot create_love_plot(balance) } # }

title: Calculate Number Needed to Treat (NNT) / Number Needed to Harm (NNH) — calculate_nnt
text: rd Numeric. Risk difference (treatment - control) rd_lower Numeric. Lower CI bound risk difference rd_upper Numeric. Upper CI bound risk difference event_type Character. "benefit" favorable outcomes (default), "harm" adverse events

title: Calculate Number Needed to Treat (NNT) / Number Needed to Harm (NNH) — calculate_nnt
text: list : nnt: Number needed treat (positive) harm (negative) nnt_lower: Lower CI bound nnt_upper: Upper CI bound interpretation: Text interpretation

title: Calculate Number Needed to Treat (NNT) / Number Needed to Harm (NNH) — calculate_nnt
text: NNT = 1 / absolute_risk_difference CI RD crosses zero, NNT CI include infinity, indicating treatment effect statistically significant. GBA benefit assessment, NNT provides clinically interpretable measure absolute treatment effect.

title: Calculate Number Needed to Treat (NNT) / Number Needed to Harm (NNH) — calculate_nnt
code: # Treatment increases response rate (beneficial for benefit endpoint) calculate_nnt(rd = 0.10, rd_lower = 0.05, rd_upper = 0.15) #> $nnt #> [1] 10 #>  #> $nnt_lower #> [1] 6.666667 #>  #> $nnt_upper #> [1] 20 #>  #> $rd #> [1] 0.1 #>  #> $rd_lower #> [1] 0.05 #>  #> $rd_upper #> [1] 0.15 #>  #> $ci_crosses_zero #> [1] FALSE #>  #> $event_type #> [1] "benefit" #>  #> $interpretation #> [1] "NNT = 10 (95% CI: 6.7 to 20). Treat 10 patients for one additional patient to benefit." #>   # Treatment reduces adverse events (beneficial for harm endpoint) calculate_nnt(   rd = -0.08, rd_lower = -0.14, rd_upper = -0.02, event_type = "harm" ) #> $nnt #> [1] 12.5 #>  #> $nnt_lower #> [1] 7.142857 #>  #> $nnt_upper #> [1] 50 #>  #> $rd #> [1] -0.08 #>  #> $rd_lower #> [1] -0.14 #>  #> $rd_upper #> [1] -0.02 #>  #> $ci_crosses_zero #> [1] FALSE #>  #> $event_type #> [1] "harm" #>  #> $interpretation #> [1] "NNT = 12.5 (95% CI: 7.1 to 50). Treat 12 patients for one additional patient to benefit." #>   # Non-significant effect (CI crosses zero) calculate_nnt(rd = -0.05, rd_lower = -0.12, rd_upper = 0.02) #> $nnt #> [1] -20 #>  #> $nnt_lower #> [1] 8.333333 #>  #> $nnt_upper #> [1] -50 #>  #> $rd #> [1] -0.05 #>  #> $rd_lower #> [1] -0.12 #>  #> $rd_upper #> [1] 0.02 #>  #> $ci_crosses_zero #> [1] TRUE #>  #> $event_type #> [1] "benefit" #>  #> $interpretation #> [1] "Effect not statistically significant (CI crosses zero). Point estimate NNT = 20 to harm" #>

what: Calculate Standardized Mean Difference for Continuous Variables — calculate_smd
title: Calculate Standardized Mean Difference for Continuous Variables — calculate_smd
text: Calculates standardized mean difference (SMD) two groups continuous variables using either Cohen's d Hedges' g. SMD key metric assessing baseline balance randomized controlled trials, particularly important GBA/AMNOG dossier submissions.

title: Calculate Standardized Mean Difference for Continuous Variables — calculate_smd
code: calculate_smd(   mean1,   sd1,   n1,   mean2,   sd2,   n2,   method = c("cohens_d", "hedges_g"),   conf_level = 0.95 )

title: Calculate Standardized Mean Difference for Continuous Variables — calculate_smd
text: mean1 Numeric. Mean group 1 (treatment group). sd1 Numeric. Standard deviation group 1. Must positive. n1 Integer. Sample size group 1. Must >= 2. mean2 Numeric. Mean group 2 (control/reference group). sd2 Numeric. Standard deviation group 2. Must positive. n2 Integer. Sample size group 2. Must >= 2. method Character. Method calculating SMD. One : "cohens_d" (default): Uses pooled standard deviation "hedges_g": Applies small-sample bias correction Cohen's d conf_level Numeric. Confidence level CI calculation (default: 0.95).

title: Calculate Standardized Mean Difference for Continuous Variables — calculate_smd
text: named list components: smd: standardized mean difference ci_lower: Lower bound confidence interval ci_upper: Upper bound confidence interval method: Method used ("cohens_d" "hedges_g") se: Standard error SMD

title: Calculate Standardized Mean Difference for Continuous Variables — calculate_smd
text: Cohen's d calculated : $$d = \frac{\bar{x}_1 - \bar{x}_2}{s_{pooled}}$$ \(s_{pooled} = \sqrt{\frac{(n_1-1)s_1^2 + (n_2-1)s_2^2}{n_1+n_2-2}}\) Hedges' g applies correction factor small samples: $$g = d \times \left(1 - \frac{3}{4(n_1+n_2)-9}\right)$$ 95% confidence interval calculated using large-sample variance: $$Var(d) = \frac{n_1+n_2}{n_1 n_2} + \frac{d^2}{2(n_1+n_2)}$$

title: Calculate Standardized Mean Difference for Continuous Variables — calculate_smd
text: Cohen, J. (1988). Statistical Power Analysis Behavioral Sciences (2nd ed.). Lawrence Erlbaum Associates. Hedges, L. V., & Olkin, . (1985). Statistical Methods Meta-Analysis. Academic Press.

title: Calculate Standardized Mean Difference for Continuous Variables — calculate_smd
code: # Cohen's d for age between treatment groups calculate_smd(   mean1 = 55.2, sd1 = 12.3, n1 = 150,   mean2 = 53.8, sd2 = 11.9, n2 = 148 ) #> $smd #> [1] 0.1156738 #>  #> $ci_lower #> [1] -0.1115965 #>  #> $ci_upper #> [1] 0.342944 #>  #> $method #> [1] "cohens_d" #>  #> $se #> [1] 0.1159563 #>   # Hedges' g with small sample correction calculate_smd(   mean1 = 55.2, sd1 = 12.3, n1 = 25,   mean2 = 53.8, sd2 = 11.9, n2 = 23,   method = "hedges_g" ) #> $smd #> [1] 0.1137085 #>  #> $ci_lower #> [1] -0.4530328 #>  #> $ci_upper #> [1] 0.6804498 #>  #> $method #> [1] "hedges_g" #>  #> $se #> [1] 0.289159 #>

title: Calculate Standardized Mean Difference for Binary Variables — calculate_smd_binary
text: p1 Numeric. Proportion group 1 (treatment). Must 0 1. n1 Integer. Sample size group 1. Must >= 2. p2 Numeric. Proportion group 2 (control). Must 0 1. n2 Integer. Sample size group 2. Must >= 2. method Character. Method calculating SMD. One : "arcsine" (default): Uses arcsine square root transformation "logit": Uses logit transformation (log odds) "raw": Raw proportion difference standardized pooled variance conf_level Numeric. Confidence level CI (default: 0.95)

title: Calculate Standardized Mean Difference for Binary Variables — calculate_smd_binary
text: named list components: smd: standardized mean difference ci_lower: Lower bound confidence interval ci_upper: Upper bound confidence interval method: Method used se: Standard error SMD

title: Calculate Standardized Mean Difference for Binary Variables — calculate_smd_binary
text: Arcsine method (recommended proportions): $$SMD = 2 \times (\arcsin(\sqrt{p_1}) - \arcsin(\sqrt{p_2}))$$ transformation stabilizes variance across range proportions bounded, making suitable proportions near 0 1. Logit method (log odds ratio): Calculates log odds ratio standardizes: $$SMD = \frac{\log()}{\pi/\sqrt{3}}$$ \(= \frac{p_1/(1-p_1)}{p_2/(1-p_2)}\) Raw method: $$SMD = \frac{p_1 - p_2}{\sqrt{p(1-p)}}$$ \(p = \frac{n_1 p_1 + n_2 p_2}{n_1 + n_2}\)

title: Calculate Standardized Mean Difference for Binary Variables — calculate_smd_binary
text: Austin, P. C. (2009). Balance diagnostics comparing distribution baseline covariates treatment groups propensity-score matched samples. Statistics Medicine, 28(25), 3083-3107.

title: Calculate Standardized Mean Difference for Binary Variables — calculate_smd_binary
code: # Compare sex distribution (60% female in treatment, 55% in control) calculate_smd_binary(p1 = 0.60, n1 = 150, p2 = 0.55, n2 = 148) #> $smd #> [1] 0.1011905 #>  #> $ci_lower #> [1] -0.1258899 #>  #> $ci_upper #> [1] 0.3282709 #>  #> $method #> [1] "arcsine" #>  #> $se #> [1] 0.1158595 #>   # Using logit transformation calculate_smd_binary(   p1 = 0.60, n1 = 150,   p2 = 0.55, n2 = 148,   method = "logit" ) #> $smd #> [1] 0.1129091 #>  #> $ci_lower #> [1] -0.1406897 #>  #> $ci_upper #> [1] 0.3665079 #>  #> $method #> [1] "logit" #>  #> $se #> [1] 0.1293895 #>

text: data ADaMData object data frame containing survival data time_var Time variable name (default: "AVAL") event_var Event variable name. NULL none. xlim Optional x-axis limits c(min, max) palette Optional color palette treatment groups. Can character vector colors, NULL use getOption("pharmhand.palette"). Defaults CVD-friendly "Okabe-Ito" palette. built-options: "R4", "Tableau 10", "Alphabet", etc. (see grDevices::palette.pals()). conf_level Confidence level CI bands (default: 0.95) base_size Base font size plot text elements (default: 11). title: Create Subgroup Analysis Table — create_subgroup_table
code: create_subgroup_table(   data,   subgroups,   endpoint_type = c("tte", "binary"),   time_var = "AVAL",   event_var = "CNSR",   response_var = "AVALC",   response_values = c("CR", "PR"),   trt_var = "TRT01P",   ref_group = NULL,   conf_level = 0.95,   show_interaction = TRUE,   adjust_method = c("none", "holm", "hochberg", "hommel", "bonferroni", "BH", "fdr",     "BY"),   title = "Subgroup Analysis",   autofit = TRUE )

title: Create Subgroup Analysis Table — create_subgroup_table
text: data ADaMData object data frame subgroups Named list mapping variable names display labels, e.g., list(AGEGR1 = "Age Group", SEX = "Sex", RACE = "Race") endpoint_type "tte" time--event (HR) "binary" binary outcomes () time_var Time variable TTE endpoints (default: "AVAL") event_var Event variable TTE endpoints. "CNSR", inverted automatically. Default: "CNSR" response_var Response variable binary endpoints (default: "AVALC") response_values Values indicating response binary endpoints (default: c("CR", "PR")) trt_var Treatment variable name (default: "TRT01P") ref_group Reference treatment group. NULL, uses first level. conf_level Confidence level (default: 0.95) show_interaction Logical, calculate show interaction p-values (default: TRUE) adjust_method Character. Method adjusting interaction p-values multiple comparisons. One : "none" (default): adjustment "holm": Holm-Bonferroni step-(recommended FWER control) "hochberg": Hochberg step-(controls FWER) "bonferroni": Bonferroni correction (conservative) "BH" "fdr": Benjamini-Hochberg (controls FDR) "": Benjamini-Yekutieli (controls FDR dependency) See adjust_pvalues details. title Table title autofit Logical, whether autofit column widths (default: TRUE)

title: Create Time-to-Event Summary Table — create_tte_summary_table
text: data ADaMData object data frame containing TTE data time_var Time variable name (default: "AVAL") event_var Event indicator variable. "CNSR" (ADaM censoring flag), automatically inverted (0=event becomes 1=event). Otherwise expects 1=event, 0=censor. Default: "CNSR" trt_var Treatment variable name (default: "TRT01P") ref_group Reference group HR calculation. NULL, uses first level treatment variable. conf_level Confidence level intervals (default: 0.95) landmarks Numeric vector timepoints landmark survival estimates (e.g., c(12, 24) 12 24 month rates). NULL none. time_unit Character string time unit display (default: "months") title Table title autofit Logical, whether autofit column widths (default: TRUE)

title: Translate a Key to the Current Locale — tr
text: Translates single key vector keys currently active locale. primary function internationalization pharmhand.

code: tr(key, locale = NULL)

title: Translate a Key to the Current Locale — tr
text: key Character. translation key vector keys (e.g., "treatment", "hazard_ratio", c("age", "sex")). locale Character NULL. Optional locale use instead current default. NULL (default), uses locale set_locale().

title: Translate a Key to the Current Locale — tr
text: Character vector translated strings. key found, returns key warning.

title: Translate a Key to the Current Locale — tr
text: Translation keys case-insensitive use underscores separate words (snake_case). Available keys can viewed using get_translations(). Custom translations can added using add_translation(). Custom translations take precedence built-translations.

title: Translate a Key to the Current Locale — tr
code: # English (default) tr("treatment") #> [1] "Behandlung" # [1] "Treatment"  # German tr("treatment", locale = "de") #> [1] "Behandlung" # [1] "Behandlung"  # Multiple keys tr(c("age", "sex", "race")) #> [1] "Alter"      "Geschlecht" "Ethnie"     # [1] "Age" "Sex" "Race"  # Using current locale set_locale("de") tr("hazard_ratio") #> [1] "Hazard Ratio" # [1] "Hazard Ratio"

title: pharmhand 0.0.7.9000
text: Removed cli scales Imports replaced base R helpers Moved data.table patchwork Suggests (optional chef integration risk tables) Removed unused Suggests: yaml, checkmate, webshot2 Updated example report scripts use base R messaging

title: pharmhand 0.0.6.9000
text: adjust_pvalues(): Apply Bonferroni, Holm, BH, Hochberg corrections create_subgroup_table() now supports adjust_method parameter Added calculate_nnt() Number Needed Treat calculation confidence intervals

title: pharmhand 0.0.5.9000
text: set_locale() / get_locale(): Set retrieve current locale (“en” “de”) tr(): Translate keys current locale tr_col(): Translate data frame column names get_translations(): Get translations locale add_translation(): Add custom translations reset_custom_translations(): Clear custom translations list_translation_keys(): List available translation keys Built-German translations common clinical trial terms (demographics, AEs, efficacy endpoints, populations)

title: pharmhand 0.0.4.9000
text: table functions now consistently use trt_var = "TRT01P" default create_primary_endpoint_table(), create_cfb_summary_table(), create_vs_by_visit_table() now accept trt_var parameter Safety tables (create_ae_table()) default changed “TRT01A” “TRT01P” consistency Accessible via create_ae_table(type = "comparison") Calculates risk difference (RD) risk ratio (RR) confidence intervals Supports grouping SOC, PT, overall Configurable reference group incidence threshold filtering Chi-square Fisher’s exact test p-values

title: pharmhand 0.0.3.9000
text: calculate_smd(): Cohen’s d Hedges’ g continuous variables calculate_smd_binary(): Arcsine/logit methods binary variables calculate_smd_from_data(): Auto-detect variable type data add_smd_to_table(): Add SMD column demographics tables assess_baseline_balance(): Comprehensive multi-variable assessment create_love_plot(): Covariate balance visualization (Love plot) BalanceAssessment S7 class storing assessment results Updated baseline-tables vignette SMD examples

title: pharmhand 0.0.2.9000
text: Vignettes now display generated tables using flextable rendering Large tables (SOC/PT, lab shift, medical history, conmeds) collapsible <details> tags Added dark mode support pkgdown site tables via CSS overrides flextable compatibility Fixed format_spec() roxygen documentation
